intro: Aquilegia ullepitschii, commonly known as the Alpine Columbine, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its showy, spurred petals that come in shades of red, purple, and white. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, preferring well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade. Its foliage consists of deeply lobed leaves, and it produces clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Aquilegia ullepitschii is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting pollinators.
